import React from 'react'; import { Container, Row, Col , Form} from 'reactstrap'; import { useParams } from 'react-router-dom'; // Import useParams from react-router-dom import tourData from '../assets/data/tours'; import calculateAvgRating from '../utils/avgRating'; import '../style/tour-details.css' import { ListGroup } from 'reactstrap'; import avatar from '../assets/images/avatar.jpg'; const TourDetails = () => { const { id } = useParams(); // Correct the usage of useParams() // This is your static data; in a real app, you'd fetch this from an API or database const tour = tourData.find((tour) => tour.id === id); // Destructuring properties from the tour object const { photo, title, desc, price,address, reviews, city, distance, maxGroupSize } = tour; const {totalRating , avgRating} = calculateAvgRating(reviews) //formate data const options = {day:'numeric' , month:'long' , year:'numeric'} return ( <>
{/* Fix the classname to className */}

{title}

{calculateAvgRating === 0 ? null : avgRating} {totalRating === 0 ? "Not rated" : null} ({reviews?.length}) {address}
{city} ${price} / per person {maxGroupSize}
Description

{desc}

{/*=========== tour reviews section============*/}

Reviews ({reviews?.length} reviews)

1 2 3 4 5
{ reviews?.map(review=>(
priti

{new Date('01-18-2023').toLocaleDateString('en-US',options)}

)) }
{/*=========== tour reviews section end============*/}
) } export default TourDetails;
